transcription.text: Thank you for the introduction and mostly thank you for having us as a key here to help
the Ethereum Foundation and the development of Ethereum.
We are a mobile development studio from Czech Republic, Prague, so our office is somewhere
over there.
And we are one of the grantees and we have developed the library, which I will speak
about later on, just some of our background, like I said, we are here from Prague and we
are quite a big company, no startup anymore, we have over 50 members.
Basically we develop mobile apps, but by mobile app there is also some backend on VixLiketis
and we have quite a strong research background as well.
That's why we try to connect two worlds together, the world of blockchain and the world of mobile
apps.
And besides this cool stuff with blockchain, our regular work, our applications like new
application for a Buddhist stack, but this is another topic what we did here is this
project which I will introduce Friday so I will not speak about it too much now, but
it's the library and code again for Ethereum for iOS and basically it allows mobile developers
who are developing native mobile apps on iOS to work with Ethereum smart contracts like
if it was an SDK so there is no need to parse the web interface anymore, it's already released
as an open source, if you are interested in this stuff you can come to my Friday talk
and besides that I will just mention two other projects that we do and I've asked James if
it's okay to work here, Tezos about blockchain is one big family as I was told so that's
not a problem, we also do similar stuff for Tezos Commons Foundation and we also have
one our own app which is fun to go I was sitting near Tom and he presented here rock paper
scissors which we have as well but our use case is completely different, this is an
app we had in store for about two years, it was just a result of our weekend hackathon
and it was it was very centralized, you can send these messages over not blockchain but
Facebook messenger and lately we have implemented an option to make bets in tokens which we
have used in tokens for because it works quite well as well and it's based on Ethereum so
this app will be in the store in about two weeks so rock paper scissors is really a
good use case for blockchain and besides that I would like to invite you for some events
that will be occurring this week so at Thursday if you would be more interested in the dev
kit we have developed for Ethereum Foundation we will have some kind of hands-on workshop
for developers in our office you can freely come there, it's listed on amnibrite so just
register there, it's called Ethereum's IOS DevKit hands-on workshop hosted by Ekki and
there we will demonstrate how to create a native mobile app that calls Ethereum smart
contracts in less than one hour at least this is what our developers promised and of
course there will be discussion so you are invited to come and I guess at Friday I will
officially announce it here in the ultra violet room and I would also like to invite you because
the whole week there is a series of site events which is called Prague blockchain week so you
can check on Prague blockchain week.com and there is plenty of events for each night and
it's not during the day during the conference and some of them take place in our office
so if you would be interested these events happen in our office which you will find looks
like this we are in the very top of this building this is how it looks like and this is our
team and we will be happy to meet with you thank you.
[Applause]
[Music]
[Music]
[Music]
[Music]
[Music]
